events.event_name: Moldova Holds Key Policy Rate at 5%
events.description: The National Bank of Moldova left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5% on February 5, 2026.

facts.fact_text: The National Bank of Moldova left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5% on February 5, 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The National Bank of Moldova left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5% on February 5, 2026

facts.fact_text: Inflation eased to a one-year low of 6.8% in December 2025, down from 7% in November.

evidences.evidence_text: Inflation eased to a one-year low of 6.8% in December 2025, down from 7% in November

facts.fact_text: The central bank reduced reserve requirements in both Moldovan lei and freely convertible currency.

evidences.evidence_text: At the same time, the central bank reduced reserve requirements in both Moldovan lei and freely convertible currency to meet the banking system’s liquidity needs.

claims.claim_text: The decision aims to maintain medium-term inflation within ±1.5 percentage points of the 5% target, deemed optimal for sustainable economic growth.
claims.author: National Bank of Moldova

evidences.evidence_text: The decision takes into account the delayed effects of prior monetary policies and aims to maintain medium-term inflation within ±1.5 percentage points of the 5% target, deemed optimal for sustainable economic growth.

claims.claim_text: Inflation is expected to return to the target range in the first quarter, remaining close to target thereafter.
claims.author: National Bank of Moldova

evidences.evidence_text: Inflation eased to a one-year low of 6.8% in December 2025, down from 7% in November, and is expected to return to the target range in the first quarter, remaining close to target thereafter.

claims.claim_text: This measure is expected to increase lending capacity to the real and public sectors, supporting aggregate demand by encouraging consumption and investment, and helping balance the national economy and the current account.
claims.author: National Bank of Moldova

evidences.evidence_text: This measure is expected to increase lending capacity to the real and public sectors, supporting aggregate demand by encouraging consumption and investment, and helping balance the national economy and the current account.

evidence.evidence_text: Moldova Holds Key Policy Rate at 5%
The decision takes into account the delayed effects of prior monetary policies and aims to maintain medium-term inflation within ±1.5 percentage points of the 5% target
deemed optimal for sustainable economic growth
At the same time, the central bank reduced reserve requirements in both Moldovan lei and freely convertible currency to meet the banking system’s liquidity needs.

This measure is expected to increase lending capacity to the real and public sectors, supporting aggregate demand by encouraging consumption and investment, and helping balance the national economy and the current account.
